overview: Four middle-aged Jutland men are relaxing in their refuge, the local bathing club sauna. Their peace and quiet is shattered when Michael, a Copenhagen artist, and Jean-Paul, a Frenchman with Moroccan ancestry enter the sauna. The foursome is bemused by the intruders' presence. Due to the language barrier created by the newcomers' English conversation and the bigoted values they perceive the situation through, the foursome begin to question the newcomers' motives for being there.
title: Tide
